members.name: scheduleSyncDelayedTask
members.comment: Schedules a once off task to occur after a delay. This task will be executed by the main server thread.

param: plugin - Plugin that owns the task
task - Task to be executed
delay - Delay in server ticks before executing task
return: Task id number (-1 if scheduling failed)

param: plugin - Plugin that owns the task
task - Task to be executed
delay - Delay in server ticks before executing task
return: Task id number (-1 if scheduling failed)

members.name: scheduleSyncDelayedTask
members.comment: Schedules a once off task to occur as soon as possible. This task will be executed by the main server thread.

param: plugin - Plugin that owns the task
task - Task to be executed
return: Task id number (-1 if scheduling failed)

param: plugin - Plugin that owns the task
task - Task to be executed
return: Task id number (-1 if scheduling failed)

members.name: scheduleSyncRepeatingTask
members.comment: Schedules a repeating task. This task will be executed by the main server thread.

param: plugin - Plugin that owns the task
task - Task to be executed
delay - Delay in server ticks before executing first repeat
period - Period in server ticks of the task
return: Task id number (-1 if scheduling failed)

param: plugin - Plugin that owns the task
task - Task to be executed
delay - Delay in server ticks before executing first repeat
period - Period in server ticks of the task
return: Task id number (-1 if scheduling failed)

members.name: scheduleAsyncDelayedTask
members.comment: Asynchronous tasks should never access any API in Bukkit. Great care should be taken to assure the thread-safety of asynchronous tasks. Schedules a once off task to occur after a delay. This task will be executed by a thread managed by the scheduler.

param: plugin - Plugin that owns the task
task - Task to be executed
delay - Delay in server ticks before executing task
return: Task id number (-1 if scheduling failed)

members.name: scheduleAsyncDelayedTask
members.comment: Asynchronous tasks should never access any API in Bukkit. Great care should be taken to assure the thread-safety of asynchronous tasks. Schedules a once off task to occur as soon as possible. This task will be executed by a thread managed by the scheduler.

param: plugin - Plugin that owns the task
task - Task to be executed
return: Task id number (-1 if scheduling failed)

members.name: scheduleAsyncRepeatingTask
members.comment: Asynchronous tasks should never access any API in Bukkit. Great care should be taken to assure the thread-safety of asynchronous tasks. Schedules a repeating task. This task will be executed by a thread managed by the scheduler.

param: plugin - Plugin that owns the task
task - Task to be executed
delay - Delay in server ticks before executing first repeat
period - Period in server ticks of the task
return: Task id number (-1 if scheduling failed)

members.name: callSyncMethod
members.comment: Calls a method on the main thread and returns a Future object. This task will be executed by the main server thread. Note: The Future.get() methods must NOT be called from the main thread. Note2: There is at least an average of 10ms latency until the isDone() method returns true.

param: plugin - Plugin that owns the task
task - Task to be executed
return: Future Future object related to the task

members.name: cancelTask
members.comment: Removes task from scheduler.

param: taskId - Id number of task to be removed

members.name: cancelTasks
members.comment: Removes all tasks associated with a particular plugin from the scheduler.

param: plugin - Owner of tasks to be removed

members.name: isCurrentlyRunning
members.comment: Check if the task currently running. A repeating task might not be running currently, but will be running in the future. A task that has finished, and does not repeat, will not be running ever again. Explicitly, a task is running if there exists a thread for it, and that thread is alive.

param: taskId - The task to check.
return: If the task is currently running.

members.name: isQueued
members.comment: Check if the task queued to be run later. If a repeating task is currently running, it might not be queued now but could be in the future. A task that is not queued, and not running, will not be queued again.

param: taskId - The task to check.
return: If the task is queued to be run.

members.name: getActiveWorkers
members.comment: Returns a list of all active workers. This list contains asynch tasks that are being executed by separate threads.

return: Active workers

members.name: getPendingTasks
members.comment: Returns a list of all pending tasks. The ordering of the tasks is not related to their order of execution.

return: Active workers

members.name: runTask
members.comment: Returns a task that will run on the next server tick.

param: plugin - the reference to the plugin scheduling task
task - the task to be run
throws: IllegalArgumentException - if plugin is null
IllegalArgumentException - if task is null
return: a BukkitTask that contains the id number

members.name: runTask
members.comment: Returns a task that will run on the next server tick.

param: plugin - the reference to the plugin scheduling task
task - the task to be run
throws: IllegalArgumentException - if plugin is null
IllegalArgumentException - if task is null

param: plugin - the reference to the plugin scheduling task
task - the task to be run
throws: IllegalArgumentException - if plugin is null
IllegalArgumentException - if task is null
return: a BukkitTask that contains the id number

members.name: runTaskAsynchronously
members.comment: Asynchronous tasks should never access any API in Bukkit. Great care should be taken to assure the thread-safety of asynchronous tasks. Returns a task that will run asynchronously.

param: plugin - the reference to the plugin scheduling task
task - the task to be run
throws: IllegalArgumentException - if plugin is null
IllegalArgumentException - if task is null
return: a BukkitTask that contains the id number

members.name: runTaskAsynchronously
members.comment: Asynchronous tasks should never access any API in Bukkit. Great care should be taken to assure the thread-safety of asynchronous tasks. Returns a task that will run asynchronously.

param: plugin - the reference to the plugin scheduling task
task - the task to be run
throws: IllegalArgumentException - if plugin is null
IllegalArgumentException - if task is null

param: plugin - the reference to the plugin scheduling task
task - the task to be run
throws: IllegalArgumentException - if plugin is null
IllegalArgumentException - if task is null
return: a BukkitTask that contains the id number

members.name: runTaskLater
members.comment: Returns a task that will run after the specified number of server ticks.

param: plugin - the reference to the plugin scheduling task
task - the task to be run
delay - the ticks to wait before running the task
throws: IllegalArgumentException - if plugin is null
IllegalArgumentException - if task is null
return: a BukkitTask that contains the id number

task - the task to be run
delay - the ticks to wait before running the task
throws: IllegalArgumentException - if plugin is null
IllegalArgumentException - if task is null

task - the task to be run
delay - the ticks to wait before running the task

IllegalArgumentException - if task is null
return: a BukkitTask that contains the id number

delay - the ticks to wait before running the task
throws: IllegalArgumentException - if plugin is null
IllegalArgumentException - if task is null

members.name: runTaskTimer
members.comment: Returns a task that will repeatedly run until cancelled, starting after the specified number of server ticks.

param: plugin - the reference to the plugin scheduling task
task - the task to be run
delay - the ticks to wait before running the task
period - the ticks to wait between runs
throws: IllegalArgumentException - if plugin is null
IllegalArgumentException - if task is null
return: a BukkitTask that contains the id number

members.name: runTaskTimer
members.comment: Returns a task that will repeatedly run until cancelled, starting after the specified number of server ticks.

param: plugin - the reference to the plugin scheduling task
task - the task to be run
delay - the ticks to wait before running the task
period - the ticks to wait between runs
throws: IllegalArgumentException - if plugin is null
IllegalArgumentException - if task is null

param: plugin - the reference to the plugin scheduling task
task - the task to be run
delay - the ticks to wait before running the task
period - the ticks to wait between runs
throws: IllegalArgumentException - if plugin is null
IllegalArgumentException - if task is null
return: a BukkitTask that contains the id number

members.name: runTaskTimerAsynchronously
members.comment: Asynchronous tasks should never access any API in Bukkit. Great care should be taken to assure the thread-safety of asynchronous tasks. Returns a task that will repeatedly run asynchronously until cancelled, starting after the specified number of server ticks.

param: plugin - the reference to the plugin scheduling task
task - the task to be run
delay - the ticks to wait before running the task for the first time
period - the ticks to wait between runs
throws: IllegalArgumentException - if plugin is null
IllegalArgumentException - if task is null
return: a BukkitTask that contains the id number

members.name: runTaskTimerAsynchronously
members.comment: Asynchronous tasks should never access any API in Bukkit. Great care should be taken to assure the thread-safety of asynchronous tasks. Returns a task that will repeatedly run asynchronously until cancelled, starting after the specified number of server ticks.

param: plugin - the reference to the plugin scheduling task
task - the task to be run
delay - the ticks to wait before running the task for the first time
period - the ticks to wait between runs
throws: IllegalArgumentException - if plugin is null
IllegalArgumentException - if task is null

param: plugin - the reference to the plugin scheduling task
task - the task to be run
delay - the ticks to wait before running the task for the first time
period - the ticks to wait between runs
throws: IllegalArgumentException - if plugin is null
IllegalArgumentException - if task is null
return: a BukkitTask that contains the id number
